result.markdown:
---
title: "Navigating Data Types in R"
author: "Lindsay N. Hayes"
date: 2025-07-03
draft: true
editor_options: 
  chunk_output_type: console
---


## About the activity

We will work our way through this quarto document together during class. The activity will cover using R as a calculator, creating R objects, and exploring the features of a dataset.

## First Load the Tidyverse Package

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.4     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.4     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
```


:::
:::



## Ways to Use R

### 1. Arithmetic


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# addition/subtraction/multiplication/division

193 + 45
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 238
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
2050 - 2025
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 25
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
50/250 * 100
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 20
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# activity: assign the variable my_age as the current year minus your year of birth. 
```
:::


### 2. Create R objects


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# vector
# c(..., recursive = FALSE, use.names = TRUE)
x <- c(1:225)
class(x)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "integer"
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# matrix
# matrix(data, nrow, ncol, byrow, dimnames)
y <- matrix(1:225, nrow=15, ncol=15, byrow = FALSE)
class(y)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "matrix" "array" 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# logical
# testing each variable in the vector and outputting TRUE or FALSE
over100 <- x>100
table(over100)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
over100
FALSE  TRUE 
  100   125 
```


:::
:::


### Your Turn

### A. Create a vector of all the `homeworlds` in starwars using the `starwars` data.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# create vector
homeworlds <- starwars$homeworld

# how many worlds are there? hint: use the unique function
unique(homeworlds)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 [1] "Tatooine"       "Naboo"          "Alderaan"       "Stewjon"       
 [5] "Eriadu"         "Kashyyyk"       "Corellia"       "Rodia"         
 [9] "Nal Hutta"      "Bestine IV"     NA               "Kamino"        
[13] "Trandosha"      "Socorro"        "Bespin"         "Mon Cala"      
[17] "Chandrila"      "Endor"          "Sullust"        "Cato Neimoidia"
[21] "Coruscant"      "Toydaria"       "Malastare"      "Dathomir"      
[25] "Ryloth"         "Aleen Minor"    "Vulpter"        "Troiken"       
[29] "Tund"           "Haruun Kal"     "Cerea"          "Glee Anselm"   
[33] "Iridonia"       "Iktotch"        "Quermia"        "Dorin"         
[37] "Champala"       "Geonosis"       "Mirial"         "Serenno"       
[41] "Concord Dawn"   "Zolan"          "Ojom"           "Skako"         
[45] "Muunilinst"     "Shili"          "Kalee"          "Umbara"        
[49] "Utapau"        
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# is there a world called "Ohio"? how would you test this with code?
table(homeworlds == "Ohio")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

FALSE 
   77 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# How many characters live on Naboo?
table(homeworlds == "Naboo")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

FALSE  TRUE 
   66    11 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Who lives on Naboo? (hint use the "names" variable in the starwars data and the "which" function)
starwars$name[homeworlds == "Naboo"]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 [1] "R2-D2"         NA              "Palpatine"     NA             
 [5] NA              NA              "Padmé Amidala" "Jar Jar Binks"
 [9] "Roos Tarpals"  "Rugor Nass"    "Ric Olié"      "Quarsh Panaka"
[13] "Gregar Typho"  "Cordé"         "Dormé"         NA             
[17] NA              NA              NA              NA             
[21] NA             
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
which(homeworlds == "Naboo")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 [1]  3 20 34 35 36 37 38 41 59 60 65
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
starwars$name[which(homeworlds == "Naboo")]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 [1] "R2-D2"         "Palpatine"     "Padmé Amidala" "Jar Jar Binks"
 [5] "Roos Tarpals"  "Rugor Nass"    "Ric Olié"      "Quarsh Panaka"
 [9] "Gregar Typho"  "Cordé"         "Dormé"        
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

:::

















### 2. Create a correlation matrix of some of the quality scores in the TaylorSwift data what are some features that are statistically correlated?


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# install/load the taylor package
library(taylor)
data <- taylor_album_songs

# pick what features of the data you want to explore
colnames(data)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 [1] "album_name"          "ep"                  "album_release"      
 [4] "track_number"        "track_name"          "artist"             
 [7] "featuring"           "bonus_track"         "promotional_release"
[10] "single_release"      "track_release"       "danceability"       
[13] "energy"              "key"                 "loudness"           
[16] "mode"                "speechiness"         "acousticness"       
[19] "instrumentalness"    "liveness"            "valence"            
[22] "tempo"               "time_signature"      "duration_ms"        
[25] "explicit"            "key_name"            "mode_name"          
[28] "key_mode"            "lyrics"             
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# create a matrix of those features
mat <- data[,c(12,13,15,17,18,19,20)]

# evaluate the correlation matrix
mat |> GGally::ggpairs()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Registered S3 method overwritten by 'GGally':
  method from   
  +.gg   ggplot2
```

(`stat_density()`).

```{.r .cell-code}
# check one of the comparisons using ggplot
ggplot(data, aes(x=loudness, y=energy, color = album_name)) + geom_point(size=3) + scale_color_albums()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: Removed 3 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range
(`geom_point()`).
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](classwork_L02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
mod <- lm(energy ~ loudness + album_name, data = data)
summary(mod)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data, aes(x=loudness, y=energy, color = album_name)) + geom_point(size=3) + scale_color_albums() + facet_wrap(~album_name)
```
